title: A question about obj_loss oscillating but not decreasing
body:
### Search before asking

- [X] I have searched the YOLOv3 [issues](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/issues) and [discussions](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/discussions) and found no similar questions.


### Question

Hello, glenn-jocher. thanks for your yolov3 code.
In my experiment, when I try to use yolov3-spp to train my dataset, there is a phenomenon that obj_loss keeps oscillating but not decreasing.My dataset has only 70 images, the image size is 1200x1200 pixels, each image has about 500-600 detection objects, each object is smaller than 32x32 pixels and they are all one class.

![1650695349(1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104210536/164882967-f05ebf80-b618-4822-903a-34dd70c3f3a2.png)
                                         **a screenshot from mydataset**


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104210536/164882913-6b6b5d11-d00e-45b7-8299-9aa88b6c4c4b.png)

When I was training, neither train/boj_loss nor val/obj_loss dropped to convergence, yet mAP kept rising above 0.9, which I think is strange.When I tried to tune hyperparameters, like tuning learning rate and obj loss gain(including increase and decrease), there was no good improvement. And when I tested the model, I found that there are many duplicate detection boxes that are not being nms.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104210536/164883154-b8664324-fb83-495a-86b0-5ae47ef6d8ce.png)

So I want to know how can I tune the hyperparameters, or use some other method?
